items.content_html:
Finished reading: Bourdain by Laurie Woolever üìö

Interesting biography, consisting of a bunch of anecdotes organized in themes in roughly chronological order. I think I missed a few episodes of Parts Unknown, but reading this made me want go back and watch some.
items.content_text:
Finished reading: [Bourdain](https://micro.blog/books/9780062909121) by Laurie Woolever üìö

Interesting biography, consisting of a bunch of anecdotes organized in themes in roughly chronological order. I think I missed a few episodes of *Parts Unknown*, but reading this made me want go back and watch some.

items.content_html: Starting to convert one of the WideLoaders on the xtracycle to have a spot to hold a bicycle wheel in place, if/when we need to bail out on the way home from summer camp. During the process, snapped the plastic connector on the LongLoader. Put a replacement together in tinkercad, primitive but it works so far:[Printables] (https://www.printables.com/model/488721-xtracycle-longloader-connector)
items.content_text: Starting to convert one of the WideLoaders on the xtracycle to have a spot to hold a bicycle wheel in place, if/when we need to bail out on the way home from summer camp. During the process, snapped the plastic connector on the LongLoader. Put a replacement together in tinkercad, primitive but it works so far:[Printables] (https://www.printables.com/model/488721-xtracycle-longloader-connector)

items.content_html: Recently took a break from playing No Man’s Sky on the Switch, and jumped back to playing on PC. I was watching some youtubers play extreme permadeath mode, but I opted for a less drastic version and just went on a speedrun to the center of the galaxy. üïπÔ∏è
items.content_text: Recently took a break from playing No Man's Sky on the Switch, and jumped back to playing on PC. I was watching some youtubers play extreme permadeath mode, but I opted for a less drastic version and just went on a speedrun to the center of the galaxy. üïπÔ∏è

items.content_html: PIcked up No Man’s Sky for the Switch a while back. This was my first expedition, never tried one on the PC. Mostly fun, but the infested planet with the titan worms and biological horrors was frustrating… I had a hell of a time picking up the larval cores

items.content_html: Finished reading: One Tin Bakes by Edd Kimber üìö Finally going to return this, but tried the tahini bar cookies a while back, pretty good and subtle, not in your face like peanut butter would have been. Worth looking into acquiring a copy. /#library
items.content_text:
Finished reading: [One Tin Bakes](https://micro.blog/books/9780857839268) by Edd Kimber üìö
Finally going to return this, but tried the tahini bar cookies a while back, pretty good and subtle, not in your face like peanut butter would have been. Worth looking into acquiring a copy. /#library

items.content_html: Finished reading: It’s Garry Shandling’s Book by Judd Apatow üìö Inspired me to track down episodes somewhere. Always interesting to peek behind the curtain into how things were, since I was young and/or uninterested enough back then. #library
items.content_text:
Finished reading: [It's Garry Shandling's Book](https://micro.blog/books/9780525510840) by Judd Apatow üìö
Inspired me to track down episodes somewhere. Always interesting to peek behind the curtain into how things were, since I was young and/or uninterested enough back then. 
\#library

little late, but LOTRO updates for March:

items.content_html: Finished reading: The Technicolor Time Machine by Harry Harrison üìö Gonzo time travel sci-fi from the 60’s, Vikings in Vinland… so good at being so bad.

Gonzo time travel sci-fi from the 60's, Vikings in Vinland... so good at being so bad.

items.content_html: January LOTRO progress- On the captain alt, worked through Evendim, got the Angmar Fem armor set, and got set up in the Angle. LM: worked on delvings, finished up a few of the associated deeds, almost have the writs for the gold cloak upgrade, but no necklace drop in SV yet.
items.content_text: January LOTRO progress- On the captain alt, worked through Evendim, got the Angmar Fem armor set, and got set up in the Angle. LM: worked on delvings, finished up a few of the associated deeds, almost have the writs for the gold cloak upgrade, but no necklace drop in SV yet.

items.content_html: Finished reading: Game Wizards: The Epic Battle for Dungeons & Dragons (Game Histories) by Jon Peterson üìö There are no heroes here, and definitely no business people either. Amazing that D&D even made it out of the 70s or early 80s
items.content_text:
Finished reading: [Game Wizards: The Epic Battle for Dungeons & Dragons (Game Histories)](https://micro.blog/books/9780262542951) by Jon Peterson üìö
There are no heroes here, and definitely no business people either. Amazing that D&D even made it out of the 70s or early 80s

items.content_html: LOTRO check-in: was able to tackle most of the items from December, but do find myself dropping alts and concentrating more on just the Lore-Master as things go. There’s just not enough time to maintain the dailies and gear grind.

items.content_html:
Finished reading: Ducks by Kate Beaton.

I remember when the story of the ducks hit the news, but it took me a while to make the connection. As a fan of her work from the Hark! A Vagrant Days, this was really good, but sad.

üìö
items.content_text:
Finished reading: [Ducks](https://micro.blog/books/9781787330139) by Kate Beaton.

I remember when the story of the ducks hit the news, but it took me a while to make the connection. As a fan of her work from the Hark! A Vagrant Days, this was really good, but sad.

üìö
